H0.text: Scientific tools used in experiments are most likely shared by an astronomer and a marine biologist, as they discovered while having lunch and discussing their current experiments, even though they investigate different areas of science.

H1.text: Publications for conducting research are the common resource that an astronomer and a marine biologist most likely use, as discovered while they were having lunch and discussing their experiments despite investigating different areas of science.

H2.text: Scientific method to test hypotheses is what an astronomer and a marine biologist most likely use, even though they investigate different areas of science, as they discovered while having lunch and discussing their current experiments.

H3.text: Locations for conducting their experiments are the same for an astronomer and a marine biologist, as discovered during a lunch discussion in which they noted that, despite investigating different areas of science, they most likely use the same locations.

A4.text: Karin Knorr Cetina has conducted a comparative study of two scientific fields (namely high energy physics and molecular biology) to conclude that the epistemic practices and reasonings within both scientific communities are different enough to introduce the concept of 'epistemic cultures', in contradiction with the idea that a so-called 'scientific method' is unique and a unifying concept.

A5.text: Published results of experiments can also serve as a hypothesis predicting their own reproducibility.
